# Team Member 1

## Who are you evaluating? Self-evaluation

## Evaluation Areas

#### 1. Intellectual Contributions.

*Understanding the project, doing the research, evaluating and interpreting data, creative efforts and problem solving insight, providing intellectual leadership for group.*

Score (out of 10): 10

Justification/Examples: Although our group started late, I contributed significantly from the beginning. I proposed the central idea for the project and sourced a key dataset that was crucial for our analysis. I also wrote half of the introduction, covering essential topics like fairness and care, which helped guide the team’s direction. In addition to my research and writing, I took the lead on cleaning and preparing the dataset, ensuring the data was ready for analysis. I created several visualizations based on the data, which were included in our presentation to help clearly communicate our findings. During the presentation, I presented these visualizations and explained the data insights to the team and audience. Overall, my efforts in both data preparation and presentation played a significant role in keeping the project on track and ensuring we delivered a high-quality final product.

#### 2. Team Support.

*Enthusiasm, commitment to project, cooperation, respect for other persons’ ideas, willingness to compromise as appropriate, receptiveness to constructive feedback.*

Score (out of 10): 10

Justification/Examples: I was committed to keeping the team organized and on track, especially since one member was working remotely. I set up a shared Teams space to upload updates and documents, ensuring everyone stayed informed. I consistently met deadlines and respected others’ ideas, offering constructive feedback, such as suggesting we include "before" and "after" screenshots in the data cleaning section of the presentation. I also helped divide the tasks among the team to make sure everyone had a clear role and contributed equally to the project.

#### 3. Communication Contributions.

*Effectiveness of communication within team, quality of written work, contributions toward creation of presentation and other written work.*

Score (out of 10): 10

Justification/Examples: I kept the team informed by regularly updating them on my progress and scheduling meeting times. I contributed to the report by writing the introduction, describing the data, and discussing fairness and care. For the presentation, I created data visualizations and shared key insights, ensuring that the slides clearly communicated our findings. My updates and contributions helped keep the project on track and the presentation engaging.

#### 4. Time Contributions.

*Keeping team on task, meeting deadlines, following through on plans, attendance at team meetings, does equal share of work.*

Score (out of 10): 10

Justification/Examples: I consistently kept the team on track by providing regular updates on our progress through Teams, ensuring everyone was informed. I met all deadlines for my tasks and never missed a meeting. I also contributed equally to the project, particularly in coding, where I made sure my work was thorough and aligned with the team’s objectives. My punctuality and commitment helped ensure the project stayed on schedule.

#### 5. Overall / Other Contributions

*Score any additional contributions, general remarks, or overall impression of this person as a member of the group.*

Score (out of 10): 10

Justification/Examples: Overall, I believe my contributions were vital to the success of the project. In addition to my core responsibilities, I took the initiative to help with project organization, ensuring that tasks were divided effectively and that everyone knew their roles. I was always available to support my teammates, whether it was offering feedback, clarifying concepts, or helping troubleshoot issues. My proactive approach and willingness to take on various tasks beyond my own responsibilities helped create a positive and collaborative team environment. I consistently demonstrated leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills, which made me a valuable team member throughout the project.

### Total Score (out of 50): 50
